intro: Erigeron paramensis, commonly known as the Paramo fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands called paramos, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually blue to violet in color, with ray florets that resemble petals. Erigeron paramensis plays a vital role in the ecological balance of its habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
